bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

div1.p: Report Says Arosemena Cannot Be Re-Elected [From the Henry Rose Carter Papers]

div1.head: Newspaper clipping, July 30, [1911] [Enclosed in C0127001]
div1.p:
REPORT SAYS AROSMENA
CANNOT BE RE-ELECTED

Panama, July 30.--It is understood that
the directory of the Liberal party has
submitted to the American Government
for its consideration a report made by Dr.
Ramon Valdez, former Minister of Gov-
ernment and Justice, in which he endeav-
ors to demonstrate that according to the
Panama laws and Constitution Dr. Pa-
blo Arosemena can not be re-elected to
the presidency.

It is reported that important changes in
the Cabinet will take place soon on ac-
count of political differences. Ramon
Acevedo, Minister of Government, it is
said, will be replaced by Heliodoro Poti-
mo, who is now Secretary of Public In-
struction, and the latter's place will be
filled by Dr. Alfonso Preciado.

Evansville, Ind., July 30.--(Special.)--In
a game of baseball this afternoon at
Winslow, Ind., between the Winslow team
